reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found the hotel website while searching for hotels in the Mystic area and was pleasantly surprised. After our stay here, we booked a night at another Hyatt Place because we were so pleased. Rooms are very large, clean, and bedding is very comfortable. Nice to have a small refrigerator in the room. Front desk staff were awesome. They were so welcoming and pleasant. Failed to get her name, but on the morning of our second night's stay, I broke my eyeglasses and the clerk helped me in locating an optometrist's office that could repair them, she even got directions for me....above and beyond as far as I am concerned. Only con is the breakfast, it was just so-so, stick with the cereal and fruit. On the second morning, we decided to go out for breakfast so we would not have to deal with the rude people in the breakfast area (rude guests, not staff).
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Mystic (July 26-27-28). The hotel is quaint. They have free hot breakfast (more so a kitchen where you can help yourself to pancakes, bagels, toast, oatmeal, fruit). The staff was wonderful from the front desk, to the pool attendant. The pool is a little small but clean and was just the right size for us since we have small kids. The Mystic Aquarium is within walking distance from the hotel. The Seaport is just a short drive from the hotel (5 minutes). I would stay here again. The rooms were clean, the beds were very comfy, the rooms were spacious (especially with kids), they had almost a second room next to the bedroom which was the size of a living room...Clean, clean, clean. They actually allow pets at this hotel which I found odd, however it appeared that this area was a big pet lover population. In regards to the pets, we heard a dog muffle a bark and that was it. Never noticed anything else. Great, Great place for a mini vacation.
reviews.title: FABULOUS EXPERIENCE

reviews.text: We chose this hotel because it had space available and we were a last minute booking. We arrived early, and were not able to check in, but our hostess Jamie, took all of our information, gave us a tour, and recommended places for lunch. When we came back at the appointed hour, we were delighted with our room -- spacious with a sitting area, huge flat screen TV, desk, refrigerator and wet bar. The desk staff was full of good advice as to how to best spend our one day in town. Internet connection was easy and fast. After a driving vacation full of mediocre motels, this was just what we needed for our last night on the road!
reviews.title: We'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

reviews.text: Pros: centrally located in Mystic, large tastfully appointed rooms with with living room area and fridge , large screen TV, free Starbucks in lobby, including espresso and lattes. Cons: small outdoor pool with lots of kids, breakfast ends at 9am so don't go after 8 because it was so crowded and messy with lots of kids who apparently don't have any manners or weren't supervised. The windows in the room don't open and the room a/c cycles on and off a lot.
reviews.title: Lots of pros and cons

reviews.text: Hints: walk up the block to Friendly's or the diner for breakfast.
reviews.title: Awesome Stay!

reviews.text: Centrally located to the tourist attractions. I can't picture spending more than a couple of nights in Mystic, so there's no need to find a "destination" hotel. We had a room with an adjoining door and the neighbors were loud, else sleeping accommodation was fine.
reviews.title: Good pick for Mystic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: $2 weekend happy hour beers was a nice touch with a small screen TV to watch a late afternoon game before going out. Pool is outdoors and closed seasonally, so the kids will be disappointed. Breakfast was fine - fresh fruit and assorted other goodies that you would expect on a similar small buffet.
reviews.title: not worth the price
Nice stay
reviews.text: Staff was really keen on recommending local restaurants that mostly score poorly by TripAdvisor readers. We headed into town and ate at the finer restaurants instead.

reviews.title: Nice stay
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to visit Mystic for a quick night get away. The lobby was bizarre looking, you check in literally right next to the bar/coffee bar. The suite was ok for the price, somewhat cave-like. The bathroom was small and congested.
The staff was very friendly and accomodating but I didn't feel the value was worth the price.
reviews.title: Great for the family

reviews.text: Recently stayed for a long weekend at this hotel. It is located just off 95 & very convenient to get to. It's also located in a great spot in regards to tourist attractions. I frequently stay at Hyatt properties, however this was my first time at a Hyatt Place & I was pleasantly surprised. This location in particular is clearly dedicated to service. All of the staff members were really very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly.
reviews.title: Service-focused & family friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - It does seem as though the front desk employees are over-worked as they are also responsible for answering phones & serving the snack/coffee/bar area.
reviews.title: Good quality accommodation for $129 peer night

reviews.text: The rooms were clean & had a good open lay-out.
reviews.title: Great service, location for a Mystic weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part of the stay for us was the fact that there was a seperate area that included a mini-fridge & a bar sink. This was great for us traveling with a baby. We were able to store formula in the fridge and wash the bottles in the sink without having to use the bathroom sink.
reviews.title: Excellent service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free breakfast was also a highlight of the stay. The staff kept everything fresh and refilled. Even a few minutes before they stopped serving, they were still stocking up fresh fruit.
reviews.title: Large clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hyatt delivers more than you'd expect for 3 Star hotel chain. Extremely big rooms with its own sitting area. Very comfortable bedding. Exceptionally clean. Would be a great choice for larger families. And within very close driving distances to Downtown Mystic and Stonington.
reviews.title: Huge rooms, great location, reasonable prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The negatives are nit-picky; Gym was a little sparse but entirely functional. Breakfast was decent for a hotel but a nice add-in. Didn't use the pool. Since its family friendly expect a lot of kids running in the hall during the day.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Overall, very pleasantly surprised and wouldn't hesitate to use it again.
reviews.title: Big rooms; comfortable beds
Wonderful...but one problem
reviews.text: Hyatt place in mystic is a great place to stay in the area close to everything clean comfortable great staff, and you have to try the chocolate chip cookie at the front desk, one of the cleans hotel I have ever stayed in, very friendly front desk staff, also breakfast was include star bucks coffee and hot and clod food choices for breakfast and plenty of table to sit and eat.

Our family stated at this hotel for one night while traveling up I-95. It was very conveniently located -- both right off 95 and very close to the center of town -- and a perfectly fine hotel for one night. The staff was extremely friendly (which is always a nice touch), and our room was very spacious for 3 people (two teens; one adult). The couch wasn't the cleanest looking piece of furniture, but the less squeamish of the teens had no problem sleeping on the bed while the other two of us enjoyed the very comfortable double beds. The bathroom is oddly tiny, but it is convenient that the sink and counter space are outside of the bathroom. There was also a little kitchenette area (sink, mini fridge). The pool was busy and sort of oddly positioned on the property (at the end of the parking lot), but the water was very nice and the hotel provides pool towels right there. When checking in, the hotel gave us a guide to restaurants, but we opted for a little seafood shack right down the street overlooking the water. It was great! Breakfast was included and was quite mediocre, but it would be fine for someone who eats toast, cereal, or bananas. One bummer: the coffee was not good! Overall, I'd recommend it to someone needing a place to stay near Mystic.
reviews.title: Hyatt Place doesn't disappoint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This former AmeriSuites was completely redone to hyatt standards.Our $99 a nite room came with a wet bar,large sectional sofa,huge 42 inch tv that swivels,among other amenities.
reviews.title: As close to perfect as a hotel can get-a hidden gem in Mystic Coast and Country

reviews.text: The bed was superb-lots of pillows,down comforters,and the best mattress ive ever slept on in a hotel. There was plenty of closet space and the shower pressure/hot water delivery was excellent.Our room ( #204) faced the side of the building,and other than an occasional door down the hall opening or closing,all was very quiet.We saw families with children arriving as we were checking out on sunday. Btw checkout is at noon and those who are Hyatt "Gold Passport" members can check out as lat as 3 pm at management's discretion.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was outstanding-as professional as they come. Always greeted us with a smile,always took time to answer questions,were very knowledgeable about what to see and do in the area.
reviews.title: Great hotel, especially for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other amenities include a free continental breakfast consisting of fruit,yogurt,bagels,english muffins,3 different types of cereal,orange and apple juice. Eggs,bacon and sausage are extra charge.
reviews.title: Nice friendly Hotel
Great value - fun place to stay with kids
reviews.text: Starbucks coffee,pastries and other items such as a chef's salad are available 24/7 from their "grab n go" case.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at this Hyatt in Mystic. The staff was very cordial and helpful, check in was easy. The room was very clean, and the bed was comfortable, but the room was in need of a facelift. There is a sofa in the room which was threadbare in spots and a bit dirty looking. It did not look inviting to sit on, no less sleep on which I guess you could. Fine for a quick stay, price was fair, But if returning I would go somewhere else.
reviews.title: Cordial staff, room okay.

reviews.text: We stayed three nights in this hotel in August 2010. It was a nice hotel with clean but not spotless rooms. Because it was so crowded with many families staying there we got two rooms on ground floor. In the room of my parents you could smell the pool but there was no other room available. The staff was nice end tried to help but could not really offer a solution. The included breakfast was ok. Don't expect something special. Bacon and toast were side orders and not included.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location and the staff were very attentitive and nice. The hotel was clean and the rooms were well kept and modern. The only issue that I have is the bathroom was way too small. We have stayed at the Hyatt Summerfield Suites and the bathrooms are way bigger with full kitchens. All in all, the hotel was nice and I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: had a nice cheap one night stay here and they did everything right. big room with seperate sitting area worked for me. breakfast. small loungey check in area and close to lots of stuff in mystic, though not really walkable.
reviews.title: huge clean room nice stay, good value, what else do you need?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great hotel! The rooms are like any other Hyatt Place which include lots and lots of space! This particular hotel is very clean with VERY nice staff. I have stayed here twice and plan on a third trip this coming weekend. Cannot say enough great things about this place. Especially the price!
reviews.title: Great Hotel with lots of space in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I wanted a quick weekend getaway without a long drive, so we chose Mystic because of the proximity to our town in NY. When we arrived at the Hyatt we were greeted by several friendly staff persons at the front desk. It was kind of an awkward layout though because to the right of the front desk is a snack bar where they sell cookies, snacks, coffee, etc. It was a little out of place. Our room was clean and there was a small fridge which was great. There was a desk, sitting area and sleeping area. The bathroom was super tiny and the sink was outside the bathroom. The hotel serves a continental breakfast, but not sure what architects were thinking as seating in the eating area is at a complete minimum. If you are a family with three kids you will end up bringing the breakfast food up to your room. The most negative thing about this hotel is the noise level. The rooms have no sound proofing whatsoever so you can hear everything that is going on outside in the halls and the doors slamming shut each time a guest enters/exits their room. Enduring three nights of that was maddening. From early in the morning, 6:00 am... until late at night, after midnight...you could hear every door loudly slamming shut and echoing down the hall. It was so bad that I doubt we will stay there again.
reviews.title: Noise level is ridiculous

reviews.text: We (grandma, mommy and 2-year-old) were thrilled with this place. We weren't expecting the Ritz, and we were actually pleasantly surprised. The staff is EXTREMELY helpful and welcoming, the check-in process was super-streamlined. We got in late, and found that they have a nice late-nite menu that is quick, affordable, and can come packed up to take up to your room if you have, for instance, a tired toddler. PB&J IS served, together with a nice fruit salad (v. important in our book). Nice Graco pack-in-plays provided for cribs, rooms are quite spacious and clean, and the staff bent over backwards to help us. At breakfast (which is well beyond the "continental" description), they "found" us chocolate syrup for free at the Starbucks bar in the lobby so that we could make chocolate milk for the little guy. If you are willing to walk 20-30 minutes (stroller walking time), you can walk to Mystic Seaport and save yourself parking issues - there's a sidewalk the whole way and its a very pretty walk, with a good clam shack and dairy bar on the way. We would definitely stay here again
reviews.title: A Great Find for a Family
The hotel is in a good location. Mystic...
reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location. Mystic is small so it's close to everything.
The staff is very nice and friendly.
reviews.title: Pleasant staff, lovely location and very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is kid friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a quick over night. Was very impressed with the cleanliness. Nice decor throughout. Service was excellent. Staff friendly and courteous.
reviews.title: Spotlessly Clean Great Service

reviews.text: Hyatt Place was delightful. Upon check-in we were greeted and then given a tour of lobby including dining, coffee & bar area along with business office and exercise room. Room was huge, well laid out and included everything I needed: sofa, bar, desk, big screen tv, wi-fi and king size bed. I wish I could have stayed a week. Mystic was a charming town.
reviews.title: Excellent customer service with clean, large and quiet rooms

reviews.text: Stayed here for one Friday night on a Priceline rate (purchased the day before) that ended up being under 70 bucks; a bargain at that price considering anything above ** in the area seemed to be running about $200.
reviews.title: Nicer than expected!

reviews.text: I hadn't stayed at Hyatt Place before, but it was comfortable; nice, big room with a living area, big flat-screen TV, comfortable bed. Walls were pretty thin; could hear the family next door in the morning. Doors showed signs of wear, which was weird, because so much of the hotel (touchscreens to order food in the lobby) seemed reasonably new. Free wi-fi worked like a charm throughout the room.
reviews.title: OK buth noothing to write home about it

reviews.text: One issue: Called ahead after Priceline purchase to see if they had a shuttle to Foxwoods. After having to ask two other people working at the hotel, I was told that they did! Great. When I called the day of to tell them that I'd be needing the shuttle back from the casino, they told me that because I hadn't taken the run to the casino on the shuttle (I'd gone there directly), there would be no shuttle back from the casino. They also told me at this point that the shuttle was $15, which hadn't been mentioned to me previously. This wasn't the coolest thing anyone has ever done, but it's not the end of the world, either. Shuttle to the train station in the afternoon wasn't guaranteed, but ended up not being a problem.
reviews.title: Excellent room, reasonable price
